utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, ready for lunch?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, one sec.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that the prototype drive system for the high-G rover?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, Bernadette got me a Fitbit so she can track how much I’m exercising.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’ll teach her to care about your health.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I can’t wait to see the look on her face when I die young.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: When was the last actual exercise you got?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The other day, when she tried to put that Fitbit on me and I ran away from her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: According to a recent study, simply thinking about exercise, even while sitting still, can have physical benefits. For all you know, I could be exercising right now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nah, I’ll do it tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It wouldn’t be the worst thing if we were more active.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You make an excellent point. Ooh, I think I’m getting a runner’s high.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at all these activities the university has. Rock climbing club, archery, flag football.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Had me at flag, lost me at football.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I think it’s great you guys want to get more exercise, but do you really think sports is the right choice for you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you saying? We’re not coordinated enough to play sports?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Leonard, sweetheart, you twisted your ankle playing Scrabble.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I got a triple-word score with a double letter Q. If that’s not a time to bust out the scrabble dance, what’s the point of having one? Hey, Barry Kripke started a fencing club.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. Sword fighting does hold a certain elegant appeal. And I would imagine it meets many of our personal criteria for a sport.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s indoors, so no sunscreen.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No throwing, no catching, no running.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No gym shorts that can be yanked down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or worse, up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Preach.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And as an added bonus, the word touché comes from fencing. It would be our only opportunity to use it in a non-metaphorical sense.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about a game of tag on a French schoolyard?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, touché.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Thanks for coming by.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sure. So how can we help?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, I know more women are buying comics than ever, but for some reason, I, I can’t get ’em in here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, what have you tried so far?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, I’ve, I’ve been stocking more female-oriented titles. Uh, in the bathroom, I folded the end of the toilet paper into a triangle. And, uh, you are now sitting in the official breastfeeding area.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? In a comic book store?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, don’t worry. I, I’ve got a camera right up here, so I could watch from the counter and make sure guys aren’t being pervs. Anyway, so what do I got to do to, to get you in the door?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, for starters, you might want to rethink some of this artwork. I mean, this woman’s actually on a leash like a dog.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, you don’t know the backstory. Maybe she kept jumping up on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I feel cool. Like Puss in Boots.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I always wanted to be a swashbuckler when I was a kid.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Technically, swashbuckler is a combination of two terms. Swash referring to the sound of the sword. Swash. And then buckler meaning a small shield, which you don’t have.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We can still be swashers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well said, Puss.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Gentlemen, welcome to the fencing cwub. Before we start, I just want to warn you, fencing isn’t a joke. I hope you’re not here because you think it’s going to be wike Star Wars.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not why we’re here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m here because I think it’s gonna be like Game of Thrones.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And maybe a little Princess Bride.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, I forgot about Princess Bride. That’s my answer.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Well, sowwy to disappoint you, but fencing is a sewious spowt. If you’re not wiwwing to put in the effowt, you might as well just weave now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re not afraid of physical activity.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I already ran 18 miles today.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Awwight. Let’s begin with some fundamentals. This is the en garde position. Feet are in an L. Heels in a stwaight wine. Elbow is about a fist from the wib cage. Notice my dominant weg faces fowward.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: What’s wong, Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not sure I have a dominant leg. They’re both pretty submissive.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When you’re in a public restroom, which foot do you flush the toilet with?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right. Always right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s a righty.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Okay, show me en garde. Good. Knees bent, swightwy over the toe. Non-sword hand up for bawance.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, God, I am going to feel this tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: The first move is called an advance. You move your fwont foot fowward, heel to toe. Back foot fowwows. So fwont foot fowward, heel to toe. Back foot fowwows. Now you twy. Advance. And advance. And advance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is easy. I didn’t need to wear a cup.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Good. The next move is called a wetweat. Step back. Back foot first, toe to heel. Fwont foot fowwows. On thwee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, Barry?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When can I stab one of my friends?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: In fencing, we don’t call it a stab. We call it a touch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, yes, I’m aware. But if I say I want to touch one of my friends, I’ll get called into Human Resources.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Okay, on thwee, Cooper and Koothwappawi advance, the other two wetweat. One, two, thwee. Vewy good. Switch it up. One, two, thwee. Switch again. One, two, thwee. Excuse me. Can I call you back? No, I’m teaching a cwass. Sure. Sure. An hour, tops. Yeah. Okay. Okay. Yeah. Okay. Thanks. And one, two, thwee.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Have you thought about advertising directly to females?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hmm, okay. Well, alright, what if I put up a sign in the window that said women, come in. Don’t be afraid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, have you read the online reviews for this place?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Eh, the Internet’s so negative. I try to avoid it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, Heather H says, the owner stared at me the whole time and didn’t blink once. Kelly M says, the creepy guy who runs it asked me out, then called himself stupid before I could say no. Jessica K says, I told the weird owner that I liked his shirt. He took it off and gave it to me.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: See? Negative.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: With your foil extended, kick your fwont weg up and push off with your back weg. Now you twy. And again. And again.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look at us. We’re like the Rockettes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: En garde, Leonard. Prepare yourself for a rigorous touching.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I thought you were Puss in Boots.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, right. Sorry. My name is Puss in Boots. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m looking forward to him teaching us glove-slapping.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, when my honour is insulted, and I need to challenge someone to a duel by slapping them across the face with my glove.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When was your honour insulted?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My last physical.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Again, that doctor didn’t insult your honour. Just checked your prostate.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: My name is Little Orphan Annie. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My name is Darth Vader. I am your father. Prepare to die.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, this is fun.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, good. It’s nice to see your mind off Amy.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: What’s going on with Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not that it’s any of your business, but she broke up with me.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Weawwy? Good to know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good to know? What’s that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. I hate to say it, but it sounds like he’s interested in her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s unacceptable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, buddy, I get that you don’t like it, but it’s not really up to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but he’s dumb, and his face is dumb.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, even if it’s not him, Amy’s probably going to date someone at some point.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You really think so?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course. She deserves to be happy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How dare you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, I should warn you that maybe asking Amy out isn’t a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Barry, a word?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And now the crazy version of what I just said.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you intend to pursue Amy, you leave me with no choice but to put a stop to it.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: And how are you gonna do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: By challenging you to a duel.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: You’ve had one wesson. I’ll destwoy you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is why the duel will take place at high noon, three years from today. If you’re worth your salt as an instructor, I should be ready by then. Yeah, and be warned. I’m going to touch you all over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow. That, that was crazier than I thought.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: All right, I’m not saying it’s true, but let’s, let’s consider for a moment that possibly I’m the problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You are.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You can say it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, fine. What, I mean, what can I do? I get so nervous around women.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you’re talking to us now. I mean, you don’t seem nervous.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, that’s ’cause I’m doing that trick where you imagine the audience is naked. By the way, thumbs up, ladies.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you not hear how creepy that sounds?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It was a joke.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Was it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, I’m still doing it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Don’t be offended, but, what went wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I, I guess I assumed at this point in my life, I would be married or in a relationship, or even have a pet that didn’t run away or kill itself.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That really happened?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I mean, I can’t say for sure, but I swear that rabbit looked me right in the eye before it hopped in front of that car. Anyway, the longer I’m alone, the more desperate I get.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Stuart, believe it or not, I understand. You know, before I met Sheldon, I was alone for a really long time. I was so desperate for people to like me, when I met these guys, it took everything in my power to hide my insecurity.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, we’re all feeling it. Yes, I’ll go out with you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Suddenly, the rabbit thing makes sense.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m surprised you wanted to go to a sports bar, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look at this blister. Like it or not, we’re athletes now. Besides, a bar is where I belong. I’m having female problems.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you’re cranky and retaining water, I have a theory.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, instead of focusing on Amy dating other guys, maybe you should start thinking about dating another girl.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why? You never thought you’d end up in a relationship, and then you met Amy. Maybe there’s someone else out there for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: True, but Penny’s married, and so is Bernadette. And your girlfriend has red hair and white skin, which really rubs up against my clown phobia.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe you should consider women who aren’t in serious relationships with your closest friends?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s that prostate doctor, but I’m still mad at her. Oh, there’s a woman. I’ll make her my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. Walking up to a strange woman in a bar usually doesn’t work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re forgetting something. Ladies love jocks.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How many sips of that beer did he have?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Three.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, boy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’m recovering from a recent breakup, and I’m told asking out another woman might make me feel better. And as Ash Ketchum said to Pikachu, I choose you.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a Pokémon reference.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I don’t know what that means.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, we gave it a shot. How about you?

utterance.speaker: Older woman
utterance.content: I’m married, and I’m her grandmother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, what might have been. And you, give my regards to Barnum and Bailey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Stuart took that rejection like a pro.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, he knew he was on the breast cam.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t have much experience turning men down. It wasn’t so much fun.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, you get used to it. Some guys you have to turn down over and over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And sometimes we marry them anyway.

utterance.speaker: Amy (Phone text sound)
utterance.content: Huh. Well, this is weird.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Barry Kripke just asked me out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Look at you, two guys in one day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I told you things would change if you plucked your eyebrows.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, how are you? I was wondering if you’d like to get a drink after work sometime.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. I guess I assumed that I would eventually date other people, but this is happening so fast.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What can it hurt?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I was hoping the next person I dated would be a little less like Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You mean, not a scientist?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think she means not a weirdo.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you attracted to him?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, what happens if you imagine him naked?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t have to imagine it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I smell funny. I taste salty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re just sweaty from exercise.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And kind of delicious. I wonder how many licks it would take to get to the centre of me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know it only takes one doctor’s finger.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We should let you guys talk.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t have to leave.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at me go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, Bernadette, you’re my ride.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Walk.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How have you been?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m doing all right. I tried fencing today.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How’d that go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was pretty easy. And I think my background in mathletics helped. Barry Kripke was there. I should let you know that he expressed interest in asking you out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, actually, he, he already did.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. But don’t get too attached to him. in two years, 364 days, he’s a dead man.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I said no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. I asked two women out today, and they both said no.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I didn’t know you were interested in dating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve been told it’s a good way to move on.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Anyway, um, it’s nice to see you. You look good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks. And I taste good too.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why does your Fitbit say you ran 174 miles yesterday?
